meanings.definition: A religion practiced chiefly in Caribbean countries, especially Haiti.
meanings.sent1: Some people in Haiti follow the voodoo religion.
meanings.sent2: Voodoo is an important part of the culture in some Caribbean countries.
meanings.sent3: During the festival, they danced to the rhythm of voodoo drums.
meanings.sent4: The voodoo of the Caribbean islands has a mystical allure.
meanings.sent5: The colorful rituals of voodoo ceremonies are fascinating to watch.

meanings.definition: A charm or fetish used in voodoo practices.
meanings.sent1: She carried a voodoo charm for good luck.
meanings.sent2: The voodoo doll is a common symbol in voodoo practices.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said the voodoo charm would protect him from bad grades.
meanings.sent4: The voodoo fetish seemed to hold a mysterious power.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the voodoo charm was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: To bewitch or cast a spell on someone.
meanings.sent1: The witch tried to voodoo her enemy.
meanings.sent2: Some believe in the power to voodoo others.
meanings.sent3: He pretended to voodoo his friend by waving a stick.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to voodoo him into a trance.
meanings.sent5: The magician's ability to voodoo the audience was astounding.
